articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Southwest Puerto Rico
articles.description: The 5.8-magnitude quake before dawn on Three Kings Day was the strongest so far in more than a week of unnerving temblors on the island.
articles.content:
MIAMI A 5.8-magnitude earthquake shook southwestern Puerto Rico before sunrise on Monday, sending boulders into roads, cracking house walls and frightening people out of their beds.
